node.title: Clashes in Montenegro ahead of Orthodox ceremony
node.description: The protests reflect tensions in the country, which broke away from Serbia in 2006.

node.title: 'I studied law in jail - now I want to change the system'

node.title: How Sweden arrested a suspected war criminal

node.title: FGM, sex and the men breaking taboos

node.title: Afghanistan: Life for those left behind

node.title: El Salvador president can seek re-election - court
node.description: The Supreme Court rules that presidents can serve two consecutive terms, a move attacked by critics.

node.title: Taliban break up women's rights protest in Kabul
node.description: The women say the Taliban used tear gas and pepper spray to disperse the latest such protest.

node.title: Thousands of Tigray rebels killed, Ethiopia claims
node.description: A leading general says 5,600 rebels have been killed in fierce fighting aided by airstrikes.

node.title: Find Your Pet's Historical Art Doppelganger with Google's Pet Portraits
node.description: Pet Portraits is available to use on dogs, cats, fish, birds, reptiles, horses and rabbits.

node.title: NZ to toughen anti-terror laws after knife attack
node.description: Seven people were injured, three critically, in Auckland by a known supporter of Islamic State.

node.title: Despair of Brits stuck behind Taliban lines

node.title: Was there a bomb in car struck by a US drone?

node.title: China preps for Winter Olympics as pressure grows

node.title: What rise of Taliban means for Pakistan
node.description: Some Western powers hope that Pakistan could play a role as a mediator with the new Taliban government.

node.title: Service NSW calls in police to investigate fraudulent claims for COVID-19 business grants
node.description: Police will use artificial intelligence to check all applications after the state government unearthed more than $20 million worth of fraud.

node.title: Fate of Afghan holdout valley hangs in balance

node.title: Pandemic law protesters gather at Victorian Parliament as lawyers urge government to hit pause on bill
node.description: Victorian barristers urge the state government to halt the progression of its revamped pandemic laws through parliament, as protests over the controversial new bill continue.

node.title: Capitol riot: 'QAnon Shaman' pleads guilty

node.title: Will Hurricane Ida cause a spike in Covid-19?
node.description: Residents and experts fear that the damage from the storm will go beyond destruction from floods and winds.

node.title: What Israel tells us about the way out of Covid

node.title: Former US cardinal pleads not guilty to assault
node.description: Theodore McCarrick is believed to be the highest-ranking US Catholic to face criminal abuse charges.

node.title: Who are the rivals to lead Germany after Merkel?
node.description: The Greens' candidate is the only woman, up against some veteran male politicians.

node.title: Brazen coyotes terrorise British Columbia park

node.title: Ex-prosecutor faces charges over black jogger case

node.title: Taliban says it will 'raise voice for Kashmir Muslims'
node.description: A spokesman for the group tells the BBC it plans to support Muslims in Indian-administered Kashmir.

node.title: Apple delays plan to scan iPhones for child abuse

node.description: Australia is racing to vaccinate its population ahead of a huge shift in its pandemic strategy.

node.title: Irish Leaving Certificate grades up 2.4% on 2020

node.title: El Salvador divided over Bitcoin legal tender law

node.title: In Kabul, Afghans adjust to a new, uncertain fate

node.title: Cyprus gang rape complainant appeals conviction

node.title: Finnish teenagers jailed for boy's murder

node.title: Council leader shocked at 1,350 empty army homes
node.description: Wiltshire Council's leader is calling for vacant MoD homes to be used to house Afghan refugees.

node.title: Toxic leak from Angola diamond mine kills 12

node.title: Kim Jong-un calls for action on climate change

node.title: Armless swimmer Zheng Tao dominates the pool

node.title: GM to idle North American plants amid chip shortage

node.title: China to rein in stars' pay in media crackdown

node.title: Afghan boy who ate wild mushrooms dies in Poland

node.title: US states to accept driver's licence on iPhones

node.title: Apple to allow Netflix-type apps a sign-up link

node.title: Farthing still working to rescue 'terrified' staff

node.title: The man who fought for Kashmir’s freedom from India

node.description: Muhammad Edrees Kharotai wanted to get his family out of Afghanistan and bring them to Northern Ireland.

node.title: India actor Siddharth Shukla dies at 40

node.title: Raab in Qatar for talks on Afghan evacuations
node.description: The prospect of persuading the Taliban to reopen Kabul airport will be among the issues discussed.

node.title: Anger after Paralympian is stripped of gold medal
node.description: Muhammad Ziyad Zolkefli won his shot put event but had his title revoked because he was three minutes late.

node.title: Popular podcast host Joe Rogan says he has Covid

node.title: Lynching blame game exposes Algerian elite's fears
node.description: Algerians are clamouring for democratic reforms and the weakening the influence of the military.

node.title: Beaten and humiliated for being a Muslim in India
node.description: Attacks on Muslims by Hindu mobs have soared in India, with little apparent official condemnation.

node.title: Historic impeachment trial for Danish ex-minister
node.description: Inger Stoejberg is accused of unlawfully ordering the separation of young asylum-seeking couples.

node.title: Sacklers win immunity from further opioid litigation
node.description: A US judge has approved a bankruptcy plan for the maker of OxyContin painkillers.

node.title: Mr Zelensky (finally) goes to Washington

node.title: Kashmir's separatist patriarch Geelani dies at 92

node.title: Taliban are ruthless, top US general says

node.title: 'Covered in bruises, head to foot'

node.title: US: McDonald’s hiring 14 year-olds amid shortage
node.description: The Medford branch sees flood of applications after failing to recruit older workers.

node.title: Police and medics charged over black man's death

node.title: Passport delay blamed for baby stranded in Kabul

node.title: Portugal changes vaccine rules for UK visitors

node.title: Is a majority within reach for Canada's Trudeau?
node.description: Midway into the general election, Trudeau's Liberals are struggling to gain traction with voters.

node.title: North Korea rejects offer of Chinese Covid-19 jabs

node.title: French police crash after officer fires Taser

node.title: Unknown number left behind in Afghanistan - Raab
